conclusion: Determine the condition for light rays from point S to exit the sphere without refraction.
Light rays must not hit the sphere's surface at an angle causing total internal reflection.
Total internal reflection occurs when the angle of incidence is greater than the critical angle.
Critical angle is given by sin(θc) = 1/n, where n is the refractive index.
Point light source S is inside the sphere at distance d from center O.
Light ray SP will exit if angle α with the normal is less than critical angle θc.
For SP to exit, sin(θ) < 1/n, where θ is the angle formed by OS with the normal.
Calculate maximum distance d ensuring critical angle condition holds for all P on sphere.
Using triangle OSP, cos(θ) = d/R and solve for d using sin(θ) < 1/n.
Solve inequality to find d > R sqrt(1 - 1/n^2).
